p: The District of Gampaha ( Fig 1) where the second highest number of dengue cases reported in Sri Lanka [ 6] was selected for the study. District of Gampaha is located in the Western Province in the Wet Zone and expands over an area of 1,387 square (km 2). Elevation of the district ranges from sea level to 450 m. The district experiences a temperature in the range of 21.6â€“37 oC with average annual rainfall of 1,750 mm. Precipitations are mainly received during the Southwest monsoon and second inter-monsoon seasons [ 7].
